channel.title: AlloyDB on MCP Toolbox for Databases
channel.description: Recent content in AlloyDB on MCP Toolbox for Databases

item.title: Quickstart (MCP with AlloyDB)
item.description:
Overview

Model Context Protocol is an open protocol that standardizes how applications provide context to LLMs. Check out this page on how to connect to Toolbox via MCP.

Before you begin

This guide assumes you have already done the following:

  1. Create a AlloyDB cluster and instance with a database and user.

  2. Connect to the instance using AlloyDB Studio, psql command-line tool, or any other PostgreSQL client.

  3. Enable the pgvector and google_ml_integration extensions. These are required for Semantic Search and Natural Language to SQL tools. Run the following SQL commands:

item.title: Getting started with alloydb-ai-nl tool
item.description:
Before you Begin

Complete the before you begin setup from Use AlloyDB AI natural language to generate SQL.

Step 1: Set up Database

Here, we will set up a sample AlloyDB database for testing out our alloydb-ai-nl tool.

Authenticate to Google Cloud within Colab

You need to authenticate as an IAM user so this notebook can access your Google Cloud Project. This access is necessary to use Google’s LLM models.
